casebody.data:
James Harold JONES, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 24747. United States Court of Appeals Fifth Circuit. June 18, 1968. Max P. Engel, Philip S. Goldin, Engel & Pollack, Miami, Fla., for appellant. Morton Orbach, Asst. U. S. Atty., Neal R. Sonnett, William A. Meadows, Jr., U. S. Attys., Miami, Fla., for appellee.

Before POPE,* TUTTLE and CLAYTON, Circuit Judges.

Of the Ninth Circuit, sitting by designation.

 PER CURIAM:

There was ample evidence from which the jury could find the guilt of the accused of the charges of holding and passing counterfeit federal reserve notes beyond a reasonable doubt. We find no Miranda warning issue in this case.

The judgment is affirmed.
